wikipedia_page.main: Edward Richard Stewart (5 May 1782 – 27 August 1851) was a Scottish Member of Parliament (MP) in the Parliament of the United Kingdom and a Commissioner of the Victualling Board from 1809 to 1813. and Paymaster and Inspector-General of the Marines from 1812 to 1813.

response: Stewart, the eldest son of the Rev. Edward Stewart, was born at Sparsholt, Hampshire. He was the grandson of Edward Richard Stewart and great-grandson of John Stewart, 7th Earl of Galloway.The Scots Peerage, vol. IV (1907) pp. 168–169. He played first-class cricket for Hampshire.Chisholm, 1911

After his second wife's death in April 1850, aged 31, he married, thirdly, his first cousin Jane Francis Clinton Stewart (1818–1897), daughter of the Hon. Edward Richard Stewart and granddaughter of John Stewart, 7th Earl of Galloway, on 18 October 1851. They had one child:

*Edward Richard Stewart (1782–1851), MP for Wigtown Burghs (1806–1809)R. G. Thorne, "Stewart, Hon. Edward Richard (1782-1851)", The History of Parliament: the House of Commons 1790-1820, ed. R. Thorne, 1986
* Hon. Edward Richard Stewart (1782–1851), an MP who became a Commissioner of the Victualling Board and Paymaster and Inspector-General of the Marines.
* Katharine, who married Edward Richard Stewart
